name: Craters Of The Moon National Monument & Preserve
description: Craters of the Moon is a vast ocean of lava flows with scattered islands of cinder cones and sagebrush. We invite you to explore this "weird and scenic landscape" where yesterday's volcanic events are likely to continue tomorrow.
shortDescription: Craters of the Moon is a vast ocean of lava flows with scattered islands of cinder cones and sagebrush. We invite you to explore this "weird and scenic landscape" where yesterday's volcanic events are...

address.line1: Craters of the Moon National Monument

operatingHours.description: The Loop Road is typically open from mid April through late November. High clearance four-wheel drive is highly recommended on BLM Monument roads and are impassible when snow or water is present.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: This per-vehicle fee applies to private, non-commercial vehicles and provides entrance into the park for seven consecutive days. The fee covers the driver and any passengers.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Sedan
fees.description: This per-vehicle fee applies to commercial vehicles and provides entrance into the park for seven consecutive days.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: This per-person fee provides entrance into the park for seven consecutive days. Youth age 15 and under are free.

fees.title: Entrance - Education/Academic Groups
fees.description: Classes or groups from accredited academic institutions may apply for a fee waiver ahead of their visit by contacting the park. Academic fee waivers are not granted automatically. Educational groups must apply and meet the two criteria to receive a fee waiver: 1) eligibility and 2) educational purpose and relevance of park resources or facilities. Groups that choose to not make a reservation or apply for an academic fee waiver will be charged the standard entrance fee per vehicle.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description: This per-vehicle fee applies to commercial vehicles and provides entrance into the park for seven consecutive days.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description: This per-vehicle fee applies to commercial vehicles and provides entrance into the park for seven consecutive days.

climate.weatherDescription: Weather at Craters of the Moon is characterized by hot summers and cold winters. In February, average snow depth ranges from 26 inches at the north end of the monument to just 2 inches at the south end. Intense summer sun bakes the black lava, generating surface temperatures of 170Â°F and air temperatures in the 90s. Drying winds are a daily occurrence, especially in the afternoon, and may reach 15 to 30 miles per hour.

images.title: A Sea of Lava
images.altText: A close-up shot of a folded, waving sea of lava rock, with mountains in the far distance.
images.caption: Craters of the Moon features the largest young lava field in the lower 48 states, encompassing the entire Great Rift volcanic zone.

images.title: Wildflowers on the Moon
images.altText: Small purple flowers and larger white flowers with reddish stems grow out of black volcanic rock
images.caption: Spectacular floral displays occur at Craters each spring, including this dwarf monkeyflower and bitterroot.

images.title: Stargazing at Craters
images.altText: The Craters entrance sign sits below a starry night sky, with the milky way brightly-lit.
images.caption: Craters of the Moon was designated an International Dark Sky Park in 2017, making it one of the best places in the country to stargaze.

images.title: Exploring the Craters
images.altText: A figure stands inside a large lava tube on a pile of rubble, lit by a round opening overhead.
images.caption: Many visitors come to Craters to explore its unique and fragile lava tubes.

images.title: Explore Craters on Foot
images.altText: A paved trail winds up around the side of a spatter cone.
images.caption: Trails at Craters, like the Spatter Cone Trail, allow visitors to explore young volcanic features like spatter cones, cinder cones, and lava fields.

images.title: A Weird and Scenic Landscape
images.altText: A panoramic view across the Craters landscape, bisected by a winding road.
images.caption: Craters of the Moon features unexpectedly stunning views, such as this panoramic vista from the top of Inferno Cone.
